intro: Stephanophysum hirsutulum, commonly known as the hairy stephanophysum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
